snippet: In a remote Arizona town about 40 miles from the Mexican border, the local sheriff’s deputies act as the tip of the sword as national drug and immigration policies meet desperation in a brutal desert.
abstract: Handful of local sheriff's deputies in Ajo, Ariz, 40 miles from Mexican border, are on front line of enforcing national drug and immigration policies, but they are vastly outnumbered in fight against drug trafficking and illegal border crossings; in first quarter of 2013, network of agencies patrolling border has apprehended 257 immigrants crossing and made 440 drug seizures.
lead_paragraph: In a remote Arizona town about 40 miles from the Mexican border, the local sheriff’s deputies act as the tip of the sword as national drug and immigration policies meet desperation in a brutal desert.

headline.seo: In Ajo, Ariz., Deputies Outnumbered by Drugs and Bodies
headline.main: Near the Border, a Few Deputies Are Outnumbered by Drugs and Bodies
headline.print_headline: Near the Border, a Few Deputies Are Outnumbered by Drugs and Bodies
